intro: Alsodeia physiphora, commonly known as the hairy alsike, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typical of the genus Alsodeia. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Alsodeia physiphora plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to soil fertility through its nitrogen-fixing abilities.
